paper_abstract: We show that every regular tournament on n vertices has at least n!/(2 + o(1))(n) Hamiltonian cycles, thus answering a question of Thomassen [17] and providing a partial answer to a question of Friedgut and Kahn [7]. This compares to an upper bound of about O(n(0.25)n!/2(n)) for arbitrary tournaments due to Friedgut and Kahn (somewhat improving Alon's bound of O(n(0.5)n!/2(n))). A key ingredient of the proof is a martingale analysis of self-avoiding walks on a regular tournament.
